alert.note: Alert for Pine (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 17 at 12:19PM CDT until April 21 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Minnesota... Prairie River near Taconite affecting Itasca County. Snake River near Pine City affecting Pine County. Mississippi River at Fort Ripley affecting Morrison and Crow Wing Counties. Mississippi River At Aitkin affecting Aitkin and Crow Wing Counties. .Recent rain on top of a melting snowpack has increased river levels. The resultant runoff combined with water already routing through the headwaters will cause water levels in area rivers to increase and flooding is expected to continue. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...Snake River near Pine City. * WHEN...Until Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, This will cause flooding near Cross Lake near Pine City. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:15 AM CDT Monday the stage was 9.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:15 AM CDT Monday was 9.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 9.5 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Friday morning. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.6 feet on 04/18/1965. - Flood safety information can be found at www.weather.gov/safety/flood. && Fld Observed Forecasts (1 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Thu Snake River Pine City 9.0 9.3 Mon 11 am CD 9.5 9.4 9.2 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/duluth. The next statement will be issued Tuesday afternoon by 500 PM CDT.
